conversation.text: I'd highly recommend "The Dangerous Lives of Altar Boys" for a coming-of-age tale with a touch of humor and rebellion, starring Kieran Culkin and Jodie Foster. If you're interested in a more suspenseful plot, "Shattered" might be the one for you, featuring a gripping storyline with Corbin Bernsen and Joanne Whalley in leading roles. Enjoy your movie time!

I'd highly recommend "Wonder Boys" for you! This coming-of-age film stars big names like Michael Douglas, Robert Downey Jr., and Tobey Maguire. The story revolves around an English professor who's dealing with personal and professional troubles while navigating the world of academia and literature, much like in 'The Dangerous Lives of Altar Boys'.

If you fancy a slightly different take on the coming-of-age genre, you might also enjoy "Outside Providence". This film follows a punk teenager who's sent to prep school by his father, offering a unique perspective on growing up and finding one's place in the world. Enjoy the watch!

Based on your preference for coming-of-age stories, I'd highly recommend "Better Luck Tomorrow" and "Wah-Wah".

"Better Luck Tomorrow" is an engaging film about a group of over-achieving high school students who venture into criminal activities, exploring themes of identity and the pressure to conform.

On the other hand, "Wah-Wah" tells a poignant story set in the last days of the British Empire, following a young boy's journey as he witnesses his parents' marriage disintegrate. Both films offer deep, thought-provoking narratives that I believe you might find captivating. Enjoy your movie time!

Based on your preference for a drama film from 2010 and the intriguing plot keywords you provided, I'd like to recommend "The Monuments Men." It's a compelling tale of an unlikely group of art enthusiasts who embark on a mission to rescue priceless pieces of art from the clutches of Nazi thieves during World War II. Starring George Clooney and Bill Murray, this film is filled with suspense and historical significance.

Alternatively, if you're open to exploring films outside the specified year or director, "The Last Samurai" from 2003 might also interest you. This action-packed drama follows a veteran soldier who becomes involved in the final days of the samurai during the Meiji Restoration period in Japan. Starring Tom Cruise and directed by Edward Zwick, it's a captivating journey that seamlessly blends eastern and western cultures.
